                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">

                           </span>

                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">A Lord.</span>
                        <span class="personname">CHRISTOPHER SLY, a tinker. 	</span>
                        <span class="personname">Hostess, Page, Players, Huntsmen, and Servants.</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">Persons in the Induction.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BAPTISTA, a rich gentleman of Padua.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VINCENTIO, an old gentleman of Pisa.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LUCENTIO, son to Vincentio, in love with Bianca.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PETRUCHIO, a gentleman of Verona, a suitor to Katharina.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">GREMIO</span>
                        <span class="personname">HORTENSIO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">suitors to Bianca.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">TRANIO</span>
                        <span class="personname">BIONDELLO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">servants to Lucentio.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">GRUMIO</span>
                        <span class="personname">CURTIS</span>
                        <span class="personname">NATHANIEL</span>
                        <span class="personname">NICHOLAS</span>
                        <span class="personname">JOSEPH</span>
                        <span class="personname">PHILIP</span>
                        <span class="personname">PETER</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">servants to Petruchio.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Pedant.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">KATHARINA the shrew,</span>
                        <span class="personname">BIANCA</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">daughters to Baptista.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Widow.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Tailor, Haberdasher, and Servants attending on Baptista and Petruchio.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Padua, and Petruchio's country house.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. INDUCTION</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Before an alehouse on a heath.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A bedchamber in the Lord's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before an alehouse on a heath.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Hostess and SLY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll pheeze you, in faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                     <div class="line">A pair of stocks, you rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye are a baggage: the Slys are no rogues; look in</div>
                     <div class="line">the chronicles; we came in with Richard Conqueror.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore paucas pallabris; let the world slide: sessa!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                     <div class="line">You will not pay for the glasses you have burst?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a denier. Go by, Jeronimy: go to thy cold</div>
                     <div class="line">bed, and warm thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                     <div class="line">I know my remedy; I must go fetch the</div>
                     <div class="line">third--borough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Third, or fourth, or fifth borough, I'll answer him</div>
                     <div class="line">by law: I'll not budge an inch, boy: let him come,</div>
                     <div class="line">and kindly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Falls asleep</p>
               <p>Horns winded. Enter a Lord from hunting, with his train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Huntsman, I charge thee, tender well my hounds:</div>
                     <div class="line">Brach Merriman, the poor cur is emboss'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">And couple Clowder with the deep--mouth'd brach.</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw'st thou not, boy, how Silver made it good</div>
                     <div class="line">At the hedge-corner, in the coldest fault?</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not lose the dog for twenty pound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Belman is as good as he, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">He cried upon it at the merest loss</div>
                     <div class="line">And twice to-day pick'd out the dullest scent:</div>
                     <div class="line">Trust me, I take him for the better dog.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a fool: if Echo were as fleet,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would esteem him worth a dozen such.</div>
                     <div class="line">But sup them well and look unto them all:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow I intend to hunt again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">What's here? one dead, or drunk? See, doth he breathe?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">He breathes, my lord. Were he not warm'd with ale,</div>
                     <div class="line">This were a bed but cold to sleep so soundly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous beast! how like a swine he lies!</div>
                     <div class="line">Grim death, how foul and loathsome is thine image!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirs, I will practise on this drunken man.</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you, if he were convey'd to bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wrapp'd in sweet clothes, rings put upon his fingers,</div>
                     <div class="line">A most delicious banquet by his bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And brave attendants near him when he wakes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would not the beggar then forget himself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, lord, I think he cannot choose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">It would seem strange unto him when he waked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as a flattering dream or worthless fancy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then take him up and manage well the jest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Carry him gently to my fairest chamber</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang it round with all my wanton pictures:</div>
                     <div class="line">Balm his foul head in warm distilled waters</div>
                     <div class="line">And burn sweet wood to make the lodging sweet:</div>
                     <div class="line">Procure me music ready when he wakes,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a dulcet and a heavenly sound;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if he chance to speak, be ready straight</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a low submissive reverence</div>
                     <div class="line">Say 'What is it your honour will command?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Let one attend him with a silver basin</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of rose-water and bestrew'd with flowers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Another bear the ewer, the third a diaper,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say 'Will't please your lordship cool your hands?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Some one be ready with a costly suit</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask him what apparel he will wear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Another tell him of his hounds and horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that his lady mourns at his disease:</div>
                     <div class="line">Persuade him that he hath been lunatic;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when he says he is, say that he dreams,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he is nothing but a mighty lord.</div>
                     <div class="line">This do and do it kindly, gentle sirs:</div>
                     <div class="line">It will be pastime passing excellent,</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be husbanded with modesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Huntsman</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I warrant you we will play our part,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he shall think by our true diligence</div>
                     <div class="line">He is no less than what we say he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Take him up gently and to bed with him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And each one to his office when he wakes.</div>
                     <p>Some bear out SLY. A trumpet sounds</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, go see what trumpet 'tis that sounds:</div>
                     <p>Exit Servingman</p>
                     <div class="line">Belike, some noble gentleman that means,</div>
                     <div class="line">Travelling some journey, to repose him here.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter Servingman</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! who is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">An't please your honour, players</div>
                     <div class="line">That offer service to your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid them come near.</div>
                     <p>Enter Players</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, fellows, you are welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Players</div>
                     <div class="line">We thank your honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you intend to stay with me tonight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Player</div>
                     <div class="line">So please your lordship to accept our duty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart. This fellow I remember,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since once he play'd a farmer's eldest son:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas where you woo'd the gentlewoman so well:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgot your name; but, sure, that part</div>
                     <div class="line">Was aptly fitted and naturally perform'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Player</div>
                     <div class="line">I think 'twas Soto that your honour means.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis very true: thou didst it excellent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, you are come to me in a happy time;</div>
                     <div class="line">The rather for I have some sport in hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein your cunning can assist me much.</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a lord will hear you play to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am doubtful of your modesties;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest over-eyeing of his odd behavior,--</div>
                     <div class="line">For yet his honour never heard a play--</div>
                     <div class="line">You break into some merry passion</div>
                     <div class="line">And so offend him; for I tell you, sirs,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you should smile he grows impatient.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Player</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, my lord: we can contain ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were he the veriest antic in the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, sirrah, take them to the buttery,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give them friendly welcome every one:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them want nothing that my house affords.</div>
                     <p>Exit one with the Players</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, go you to Barthol'mew my page,</div>
                     <div class="line">And see him dress'd in all suits like a lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">That done, conduct him to the drunkard's chamber;</div>
                     <div class="line">And call him 'madam,' do him obeisance.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him from me, as he will win my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">He bear himself with honourable action,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as he hath observed in noble ladies</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto their lords, by them accomplished:</div>
                     <div class="line">Such duty to the drunkard let him do</div>
                     <div class="line">With soft low tongue and lowly courtesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say 'What is't your honour will command,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein your lady and your humble wife</div>
                     <div class="line">May show her duty and make known her love?'</div>
                     <div class="line">And then with kind embracements, tempting kisses,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with declining head into his bosom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid him shed tears, as being overjoy'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To see her noble lord restored to health,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who for this seven years hath esteem'd him</div>
                     <div class="line">No better than a poor and loathsome beggar:</div>
                     <div class="line">And if the boy have not a woman's gift</div>
                     <div class="line">To rain a shower of commanded tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">An onion will do well for such a shift,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in a napkin being close convey'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall in despite enforce a watery eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">See this dispatch'd with all the haste thou canst:</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon I'll give thee more instructions.</div>
                     <p>Exit a Servingman</p>
                     <div class="line">I know the boy will well usurp the grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Voice, gait and action of a gentlewoman:</div>
                     <div class="line">I long to hear him call the drunkard husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">And how my men will stay themselves from laughter</div>
                     <div class="line">When they do homage to this simple peasant.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll in to counsel them; haply my presence</div>
                     <div class="line">May well abate the over-merry spleen</div>
                     <div class="line">Which otherwise would grow into extremes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A bedchamber in the Lord's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter aloft SLY, with Attendants; some with apparel,
others with basin and ewer and appurtenances; and Lord</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's sake, a pot of small ale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Will't please your lordship drink a cup of sack?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Will't please your honour taste of these conserves?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">What raiment will your honour wear to-day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">I am Christophero Sly; call not me 'honour' nor</div>
                     <div class="line">'lordship:' I ne'er drank sack in my life; and if</div>
                     <div class="line">you give me any conserves, give me conserves of</div>
                     <div class="line">beef: ne'er ask me what raiment I'll wear; for I</div>
                     <div class="line">have no more doublets than backs, no more stockings</div>
                     <div class="line">than legs, nor no more shoes than feet; nay,</div>
                     <div class="line">sometimes more feet than shoes, or such shoes as my</div>
                     <div class="line">toes look through the over-leather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven cease this idle humour in your honour!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that a mighty man of such descent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such possessions and so high esteem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be infused with so foul a spirit!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, would you make me mad? Am not I Christopher</div>
                     <div class="line">Sly, old Sly's son of Burtonheath, by birth a</div>
                     <div class="line">pedlar, by education a cardmaker, by transmutation a</div>
                     <div class="line">bear-herd, and now by present profession a tinker?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask Marian Hacket, the fat ale-wife of Wincot, if</div>
                     <div class="line">she know me not: if she say I am not fourteen pence</div>
                     <div class="line">on the score for sheer ale, score me up for the</div>
                     <div class="line">lyingest knave in Christendom. What! I am not</div>
                     <div class="line">bestraught: here's--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this it is that makes your lady mourn!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this is it that makes your servants droop!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence comes it that your kindred shuns your house,</div>
                     <div class="line">As beaten hence by your strange lunacy.</div>
                     <div class="line">O noble lord, bethink thee of thy birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Call home thy ancient thoughts from banishment</div>
                     <div class="line">And banish hence these abject lowly dreams.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look how thy servants do attend on thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Each in his office ready at thy beck.</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou have music? hark! Apollo plays,</div>
                     <p>Music</p>
                     <div class="line">And twenty caged nightingales do sing:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or wilt thou sleep? we'll have thee to a couch</div>
                     <div class="line">Softer and sweeter than the lustful bed</div>
                     <div class="line">On purpose trimm'd up for Semiramis.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say thou wilt walk; we will bestrew the ground:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or wilt thou ride? thy horses shall be trapp'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their harness studded all with gold and pearl.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou love hawking? thou hast hawks will soar</div>
                     <div class="line">Above the morning lark or wilt thou hunt?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy hounds shall make the welkin answer them</div>
                     <div class="line">And fetch shrill echoes from the hollow earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Say thou wilt course; thy greyhounds are as swift</div>
                     <div class="line">As breathed stags, ay, fleeter than the roe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou love pictures? we will fetch thee straight</div>
                     <div class="line">Adonis painted by a running brook,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Cytherea all in sedges hid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which seem to move and wanton with her breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as the waving sedges play with wind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll show thee Io as she was a maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">And how she was beguiled and surprised,</div>
                     <div class="line">As lively painted as the deed was done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Or Daphne roaming through a thorny wood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scratching her legs that one shall swear she bleeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And at that sight shall sad Apollo weep,</div>
                     <div class="line">So workmanly the blood and tears are drawn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a lord, and nothing but a lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast a lady far more beautiful</div>
                     <div class="line">Than any woman in this waning age.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">And till the tears that she hath shed for thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Like envious floods o'er-run her lovely face,</div>
                     <div class="line">She was the fairest creature in the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet she is inferior to none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I a lord? and have I such a lady?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or do I dream? or have I dream'd till now?</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not sleep: I see, I hear, I speak;</div>
                     <div class="line">I smell sweet savours and I feel soft things:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my life, I am a lord indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">And not a tinker nor Christophero Sly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, bring our lady hither to our sight;</div>
                     <div class="line">And once again, a pot o' the smallest ale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Will't please your mightiness to wash your hands?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, how we joy to see your wit restored!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that once more you knew but what you are!</div>
                     <div class="line">These fifteen years you have been in a dream;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or when you waked, so waked as if you slept.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">These fifteen years! by my fay, a goodly nap.</div>
                     <div class="line">But did I never speak of all that time?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">O, yes, my lord, but very idle words:</div>
                     <div class="line">For though you lay here in this goodly chamber,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet would you say ye were beaten out of door;</div>
                     <div class="line">And rail upon the hostess of the house;</div>
                     <div class="line">And say you would present her at the leet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because she brought stone jugs and no seal'd quarts:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometimes you would call out for Cicely Hacket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, the woman's maid of the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, you know no house nor no such maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor no such men as you have reckon'd up,</div>
                     <div class="line">As Stephen Sly and did John Naps of Greece</div>
                     <div class="line">And Peter Turph and Henry Pimpernell</div>
                     <div class="line">And twenty more such names and men as these</div>
                     <div class="line">Which never were nor no man ever saw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Lord be thanked for my good amends!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee: thou shalt not lose by it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Page as a lady, with attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">How fares my noble lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I fare well for here is cheer enough.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, noble lord: what is thy will with her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you my wife and will not call me husband?</div>
                     <div class="line">My men should call me 'lord:' I am your goodman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">My husband and my lord, my lord and husband;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your wife in all obedience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">I know it well. What must I call her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Al'ce madam, or Joan madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">'Madam,' and nothing else: so lords</div>
                     <div class="line">call ladies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam wife, they say that I have dream'd</div>
                     <div class="line">And slept above some fifteen year or more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and the time seems thirty unto me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being all this time abandon'd from your bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis much. Servants, leave me and her alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, undress you and come now to bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrice noble lord, let me entreat of you</div>
                     <div class="line">To pardon me yet for a night or two,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if not so, until the sun be set:</div>
                     <div class="line">For your physicians have expressly charged,</div>
                     <div class="line">In peril to incur your former malady,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I should yet absent me from your bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope this reason stands for my excuse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, it stands so that I may hardly</div>
                     <div class="line">tarry so long. But I would be loath to fall into</div>
                     <div class="line">my dreams again: I will therefore tarry in</div>
                     <div class="line">despite of the flesh and the blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Your honour's players, heating your amendment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are come to play a pleasant comedy;</div>
                     <div class="line">For so your doctors hold it very meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeing too much sadness hath congeal'd your blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And melancholy is the nurse of frenzy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore they thought it good you hear a play</div>
                     <div class="line">And frame your mind to mirth and merriment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which bars a thousand harms and lengthens life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I will, let them play it. Is not a</div>
                     <div class="line">comondy a Christmas gambold or a tumbling-trick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord; it is more pleasing stuff.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, household stuff?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a kind of history.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well see't. Come, madam wife, sit by my side</div>
                     <div class="line">and let the world slip: we shall ne'er be younger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LUCENTIO and his man TRANIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio, since for the great desire I had</div>
                     <div class="line">To see fair Padua, nursery of arts,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am arrived for fruitful Lombardy,</div>
                     <div class="line">The pleasant garden of great Italy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by my father's love and leave am arm'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With his good will and thy good company,</div>
                     <div class="line">My trusty servant, well approved in all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here let us breathe and haply institute</div>
                     <div class="line">A course of learning and ingenious studies.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pisa renown'd for grave citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave me my being and my father first,</div>
                     <div class="line">A merchant of great traffic through the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Vincetino come of Bentivolii.</div>
                     <div class="line">Vincetino's son brought up in Florence</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall become to serve all hopes conceived,</div>
                     <div class="line">To deck his fortune with his virtuous deeds:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, Tranio, for the time I study,</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue and that part of philosophy</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I apply that treats of happiness</div>
                     <div class="line">By virtue specially to be achieved.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me thy mind; for I have Pisa left</div>
                     <div class="line">And am to Padua come, as he that leaves</div>
                     <div class="line">A shallow plash to plunge him in the deep</div>
                     <div class="line">And with satiety seeks to quench his thirst.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Mi perdonato, gentle master mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am in all affected as yourself;</div>
                     <div class="line">Glad that you thus continue your resolve</div>
                     <div class="line">To suck the sweets of sweet philosophy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Only, good master, while we do admire</div>
                     <div class="line">This virtue and this moral discipline,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's be no stoics nor no stocks, I pray;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or so devote to Aristotle's cheques</div>
                     <div class="line">As Ovid be an outcast quite abjured:</div>
                     <div class="line">Balk logic with acquaintance that you have</div>
                     <div class="line">And practise rhetoric in your common talk;</div>
                     <div class="line">Music and poesy use to quicken you;</div>
                     <div class="line">The mathematics and the metaphysics,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall to them as you find your stomach serves you;</div>
                     <div class="line">No profit grows where is no pleasure ta'en:</div>
                     <div class="line">In brief, sir, study what you most affect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gramercies, Tranio, well dost thou advise.</div>
                     <div class="line">If, Biondello, thou wert come ashore,</div>
                     <div class="line">We could at once put us in readiness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And take a lodging fit to entertain</div>
                     <div class="line">Such friends as time in Padua shall beget.</div>
                     <div class="line">But stay a while: what company is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, some show to welcome us to town.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BAPTISTA, KATHARINA, BIANCA, GREMIO, and
HORTENSIO. LUCENTIO and TRANIO stand by</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen, importune me no farther,</div>
                     <div class="line">For how I firmly am resolved you know;</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, not bestow my youngest daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I have a husband for the elder:</div>
                     <div class="line">If either of you both love Katharina,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I know you well and love you well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave shall you have to court her at your pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  To cart her rather: she's too rough for me.</div>
                     <div class="line">There, There, Hortensio, will you any wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, sir, is it your will</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a stale of me amongst these mates?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Mates, maid! how mean you that? no mates for you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless you were of gentler, milder mould.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'faith, sir, you shall never need to fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">I wis it is not half way to her heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">But if it were, doubt not her care should be</div>
                     <div class="line">To comb your noddle with a three-legg'd stool</div>
                     <div class="line">And paint your face and use you like a fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIA</div>
                     <div class="line">From all such devils, good Lord deliver us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And me too, good Lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hush, master! here's some good pastime toward:</div>
                     <div class="line">That wench is stark mad or wonderful froward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But in the other's silence do I see</div>
                     <div class="line">Maid's mild behavior and sobriety.</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, Tranio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, master; mum! and gaze your fill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen, that I may soon make good</div>
                     <div class="line">What I have said, Bianca, get you in:</div>
                     <div class="line">And let it not displease thee, good Bianca,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I will love thee ne'er the less, my girl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">A pretty peat! it is best</div>
                     <div class="line">Put finger in the eye, an she knew why.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sister, content you in my discontent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, to your pleasure humbly I subscribe:</div>
                     <div class="line">My books and instruments shall be my company,</div>
                     <div class="line">On them to took and practise by myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, Tranio! thou may'st hear Minerva speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Baptista, will you be so strange?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sorry am I that our good will effects</div>
                     <div class="line">Bianca's grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why will you mew her up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Baptista, for this fiend of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make her bear the penance of her tongue?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen, content ye; I am resolved:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go in, Bianca:</div>
                     <p>Exit BIANCA</p>
                     <div class="line">And for I know she taketh most delight</div>
                     <div class="line">In music, instruments and poetry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Schoolmasters will I keep within my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit to instruct her youth. If you, Hortensio,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or Signior Gremio, you, know any such,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prefer them hither; for to cunning men</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be very kind, and liberal</div>
                     <div class="line">To mine own children in good bringing up:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so farewell. Katharina, you may stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have more to commune with Bianca.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, and I trust I may go too, may I not? What,</div>
                     <div class="line">shall I be appointed hours; as though, belike, I</div>
                     <div class="line">knew not what to take and what to leave, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You may go to the devil's dam: your gifts are so</div>
                     <div class="line">good, here's none will hold you. Their love is not</div>
                     <div class="line">so great, Hortensio, but we may blow our nails</div>
                     <div class="line">together, and fast it fairly out: our cakes dough on</div>
                     <div class="line">both sides. Farewell: yet for the love I bear my</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet Bianca, if I can by any means light on a fit</div>
                     <div class="line">man to teach her that wherein she delights, I will</div>
                     <div class="line">wish him to her father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So will I, Signior Gremio: but a word, I pray.</div>
                     <div class="line">Though the nature of our quarrel yet never brooked</div>
                     <div class="line">parle, know now, upon advice, it toucheth us both,</div>
                     <div class="line">that we may yet again have access to our fair</div>
                     <div class="line">mistress and be happy rivals in Bianco's love, to</div>
                     <div class="line">labour and effect one thing specially.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that, I pray?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, to get a husband for her sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A husband! a devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, a husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, a devil. Thinkest thou, Hortensio, though</div>
                     <div class="line">her father be very rich, any man is so very a fool</div>
                     <div class="line">to be married to hell?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, Gremio, though it pass your patience and mine</div>
                     <div class="line">to endure her loud alarums, why, man, there be good</div>
                     <div class="line">fellows in the world, an a man could light on them,</div>
                     <div class="line">would take her with all faults, and money enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot tell; but I had as lief take her dowry with</div>
                     <div class="line">this condition, to be whipped at the high cross</div>
                     <div class="line">every morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, as you say, there's small choice in rotten</div>
                     <div class="line">apples. But come; since this bar in law makes us</div>
                     <div class="line">friends, it shall be so far forth friendly</div>
                     <div class="line">maintained all by helping Baptista's eldest daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">to a husband we set his youngest free for a husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">and then have to't a fresh. Sweet Bianca! Happy man</div>
                     <div class="line">be his dole! He that runs fastest gets the ring.</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you, Signior Gremio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am agreed; and would I had given him the best</div>
                     <div class="line">horse in Padua to begin his wooing that would</div>
                     <div class="line">thoroughly woo her, wed her and bed her and rid the</div>
                     <div class="line">house of her! Come on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt GREMIO and HORTENSIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray, sir, tell me, is it possible</div>
                     <div class="line">That love should of a sudden take such hold?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O Tranio, till I found it to be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">I never thought it possible or likely;</div>
                     <div class="line">But see, while idly I stood looking on,</div>
                     <div class="line">I found the effect of love in idleness:</div>
                     <div class="line">And now in plainness do confess to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">That art to me as secret and as dear</div>
                     <div class="line">As Anna to the queen of Carthage was,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio, I burn, I pine, I perish, Tranio,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I achieve not this young modest girl.</div>
                     <div class="line">Counsel me, Tranio, for I know thou canst;</div>
                     <div class="line">Assist me, Tranio, for I know thou wilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, it is no time to chide you now;</div>
                     <div class="line">Affection is not rated from the heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">If love have touch'd you, nought remains but so,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Redime te captum quam queas minimo.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gramercies, lad, go forward; this contents:</div>
                     <div class="line">The rest will comfort, for thy counsel's sound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, you look'd so longly on the maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps you mark'd not what's the pith of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O yes, I saw sweet beauty in her face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as the daughter of Agenor had,</div>
                     <div class="line">That made great Jove to humble him to her hand.</div>
                     <div class="line">When with his knees he kiss'd the Cretan strand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw you no more? mark'd you not how her sister</div>
                     <div class="line">Began to scold and raise up such a storm</div>
                     <div class="line">That mortal ears might hardly endure the din?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio, I saw her coral lips to move</div>
                     <div class="line">And with her breath she did perfume the air:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sacred and sweet was all I saw in her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then, 'tis time to stir him from his trance.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray, awake, sir: if you love the maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bend thoughts and wits to achieve her. Thus it stands:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eldest sister is so curst and shrewd</div>
                     <div class="line">That till the father rid his hands of her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, your love must live a maid at home;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore has he closely mew'd her up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because she will not be annoy'd with suitors.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Tranio, what a cruel father's he!</div>
                     <div class="line">But art thou not advised, he took some care</div>
                     <div class="line">To get her cunning schoolmasters to instruct her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, am I, sir; and now 'tis plotted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have it, Tranio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, for my hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both our inventions meet and jump in one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me thine first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You will be schoolmaster</div>
                     <div class="line">And undertake the teaching of the maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">That's your device.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is: may it be done?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not possible; for who shall bear your part,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be in Padua here Vincentio's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep house and ply his book, welcome his friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Visit his countrymen and banquet them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Basta; content thee, for I have it full.</div>
                     <div class="line">We have not yet been seen in any house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor can we lie distinguish'd by our faces</div>
                     <div class="line">For man or master; then it follows thus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be master, Tranio, in my stead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep house and port and servants as I should:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will some other be, some Florentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some Neapolitan, or meaner man of Pisa.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis hatch'd and shall be so: Tranio, at once</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncase thee; take my colour'd hat and cloak:</div>
                     <div class="line">When Biondello comes, he waits on thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will charm him first to keep his tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So had you need.</div>
                     <div class="line">In brief, sir, sith it your pleasure is,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am tied to be obedient;</div>
                     <div class="line">For so your father charged me at our parting,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Be serviceable to my son,' quoth he,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although I think 'twas in another sense;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content to be Lucentio,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because so well I love Lucentio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio, be so, because Lucentio loves:</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me be a slave, to achieve that maid</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose sudden sight hath thrall'd my wounded eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the rogue.</div>
                     <p>Enter BIONDELLO</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, where have you been?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Where have I been! Nay, how now! where are you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, has my fellow Tranio stolen your clothes? Or</div>
                     <div class="line">you stolen his? or both? pray, what's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, come hither: 'tis no time to jest,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore frame your manners to the time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your fellow Tranio here, to save my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Puts my apparel and my countenance on,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for my escape have put on his;</div>
                     <div class="line">For in a quarrel since I came ashore</div>
                     <div class="line">I kill'd a man and fear I was descried:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wait you on him, I charge you, as becomes,</div>
                     <div class="line">While I make way from hence to save my life:</div>
                     <div class="line">You understand me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">I, sir! ne'er a whit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And not a jot of Tranio in your mouth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio is changed into Lucentio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">The better for him: would I were so too!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So could I, faith, boy, to have the next wish after,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Lucentio indeed had Baptista's youngest daughter.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, sirrah, not for my sake, but your master's, I advise</div>
                     <div class="line">You use your manners discreetly in all kind of companies:</div>
                     <div class="line">When I am alone, why, then I am Tranio;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in all places else your master Lucentio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tranio, let's go: one thing more rests, that</div>
                     <div class="line">thyself execute, to make one among these wooers: if</div>
                     <div class="line">thou ask me why, sufficeth, my reasons are both good</div>
                     <div class="line">and weighty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>The presenters above speak</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, you nod; you do not mind the play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, by Saint Anne, do I. A good matter, surely:</div>
                     <div class="line">comes there any more of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, 'tis but begun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a very excellent piece of work, madam lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">would 'twere done!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They sit and mark</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PETRUCHIO and his man GRUMIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
