                     <div class="line">Nay, hear you, Kate: in sooth you scape not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I chafe you, if I tarry: let me go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a whit: I find you passing gentle.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas told me you were rough and coy and sullen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I find report a very liar;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou are pleasant, gamesome, passing courteous,</div>
                     <div class="line">But slow in speech, yet sweet as spring-time flowers:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not frown, thou canst not look askance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor bite the lip, as angry wenches will,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor hast thou pleasure to be cross in talk,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou with mildness entertain'st thy wooers,</div>
                     <div class="line">With gentle conference, soft and affable.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why does the world report that Kate doth limp?</div>
                     <div class="line">O slanderous world! Kate like the hazel-twig</div>
                     <div class="line">Is straight and slender and as brown in hue</div>
                     <div class="line">As hazel nuts and sweeter than the kernels.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me see thee walk: thou dost not halt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, fool, and whom thou keep'st command.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Did ever Dian so become a grove</div>
                     <div class="line">As Kate this chamber with her princely gait?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, be thou Dian, and let her be Kate;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then let Kate be chaste and Dian sportful!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Where did you study all this goodly speech?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is extempore, from my mother-wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">A witty mother! witless else her son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I not wise?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes; keep you warm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, so I mean, sweet Katharina, in thy bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, setting all this chat aside,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus in plain terms: your father hath consented</div>
                     <div class="line">That you shall be my wife; your dowry 'greed on;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Will you, nill you, I will marry you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Kate, I am a husband for your turn;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by this light, whereby I see thy beauty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy beauty, that doth make me like thee well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou must be married to no man but me;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am he am born to tame you Kate,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bring you from a wild Kate to a Kate</div>
                     <div class="line">Conformable as other household Kates.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes your father: never make denial;</div>
                     <div class="line">I must and will have Katharina to my wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BAPTISTA, GREMIO, and TRANIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Signior Petruchio, how speed you with my daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How but well, sir? how but well?</div>
                     <div class="line">It were impossible I should speed amiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, daughter Katharina! in your dumps?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you me daughter? now, I promise you</div>
                     <div class="line">You have show'd a tender fatherly regard,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wish me wed to one half lunatic;</div>
                     <div class="line">A mad-cup ruffian and a swearing Jack,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thinks with oaths to face the matter out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, 'tis thus: yourself and all the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">That talk'd of her, have talk'd amiss of her:</div>
                     <div class="line">If she be curst, it is for policy,</div>
                     <div class="line">For she's not froward, but modest as the dove;</div>
                     <div class="line">She is not hot, but temperate as the morn;</div>
                     <div class="line">For patience she will prove a second Grissel,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Roman Lucrece for her chastity:</div>
                     <div class="line">And to conclude, we have 'greed so well together,</div>
                     <div class="line">That upon Sunday is the wedding-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll see thee hang'd on Sunday first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, Petruchio; she says she'll see thee</div>
                     <div class="line">hang'd first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this your speeding? nay, then, good night our part!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, gentlemen; I choose her for myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">If she and I be pleased, what's that to you?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis bargain'd 'twixt us twain, being alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she shall still be curst in company.</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you, 'tis incredible to believe</div>
                     <div class="line">How much she loves me: O, the kindest Kate!</div>
                     <div class="line">She hung about my neck; and kiss on kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">She vied so fast, protesting oath on oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in a twink she won me to her love.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you are novices! 'tis a world to see,</div>
                     <div class="line">How tame, when men and women are alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">A meacock wretch can make the curstest shrew.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand, Kate: I will unto Venice,</div>
                     <div class="line">To buy apparel 'gainst the wedding-day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Provide the feast, father, and bid the guests;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be sure my Katharina shall be fine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not what to say: but give me your hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">God send you joy, Petruchio! 'tis a match.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, say we: we will be witnesses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, and wife, and gentlemen, adieu;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will to Venice; Sunday comes apace:</div>
                     <div class="line">We will have rings and things and fine array;</div>
                     <div class="line">And kiss me, Kate, we will be married o'Sunday.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PETRUCHIO and KATHARINA severally</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever match clapp'd up so suddenly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, gentlemen, now I play a merchant's part,</div>
                     <div class="line">And venture madly on a desperate mart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas a commodity lay fretting by you:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twill bring you gain, or perish on the seas.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">The gain I seek is, quiet in the match.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No doubt but he hath got a quiet catch.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now, Baptists, to your younger daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is the day we long have looked for:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your neighbour, and was suitor first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am one that love Bianca more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than words can witness, or your thoughts can guess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Youngling, thou canst not love so dear as I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Graybeard, thy love doth freeze.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But thine doth fry.</div>
                     <div class="line">Skipper, stand back: 'tis age that nourisheth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But youth in ladies' eyes that flourisheth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Content you, gentlemen: I will compound this strife:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis deeds must win the prize; and he of both</div>
                     <div class="line">That can assure my daughter greatest dower</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall have my Bianca's love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, Signior Gremio, What can you assure her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">First, as you know, my house within the city</div>
                     <div class="line">Is richly furnished with plate and gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">Basins and ewers to lave her dainty hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">My hangings all of Tyrian tapestry;</div>
                     <div class="line">In ivory coffers I have stuff'd my crowns;</div>
                     <div class="line">In cypress chests my arras counterpoints,</div>
                     <div class="line">Costly apparel, tents, and canopies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fine linen, Turkey cushions boss'd with pearl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Valance of Venice gold in needlework,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pewter and brass and all things that belong</div>
                     <div class="line">To house or housekeeping: then, at my farm</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a hundred milch-kine to the pail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sixscore fat oxen standing in my stalls,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all things answerable to this portion.</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself am struck in years, I must confess;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if I die to-morrow, this is hers,</div>
                     <div class="line">If whilst I live she will be only mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That 'only' came well in. Sir, list to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am my father's heir and only son:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I may have your daughter to my wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll leave her houses three or four as good,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within rich Pisa walls, as any one</div>
                     <div class="line">Old Signior Gremio has in Padua;</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides two thousand ducats by the year</div>
                     <div class="line">Of fruitful land, all which shall be her jointure.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, have I pinch'd you, Signior Gremio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Two thousand ducats by the year of land!</div>
                     <div class="line">My land amounts not to so much in all:</div>
                     <div class="line">That she shall have; besides an argosy</div>
                     <div class="line">That now is lying in Marseilles' road.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, have I choked you with an argosy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gremio, 'tis known my father hath no less</div>
                     <div class="line">Than three great argosies; besides two galliases,</div>
                     <div class="line">And twelve tight galleys: these I will assure her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And twice as much, whate'er thou offer'st next.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I have offer'd all, I have no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she can have no more than all I have:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you like me, she shall have me and mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then the maid is mine from all the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">By your firm promise: Gremio is out-vied.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I must confess your offer is the best;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, let your father make her the assurance,</div>
                     <div class="line">She is your own; else, you must pardon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">if you should die before him, where's her dower?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That's but a cavil: he is old, I young.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And may not young men die, as well as old?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thus resolved: on Sunday next you know</div>
                     <div class="line">My daughter Katharina is to be married:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, on the Sunday following, shall Bianca</div>
                     <div class="line">Be bride to you, if you this assurance;</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, Signior Gremio:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, I take my leave, and thank you both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, good neighbour.</div>
                     <p>Exit BAPTISTA</p>
                     <div class="line">Now I fear thee not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah young gamester, your father were a fool</div>
                     <div class="line">To give thee all, and in his waning age</div>
                     <div class="line">Set foot under thy table: tut, a toy!</div>
                     <div class="line">An old Italian fox is not so kind, my boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A vengeance on your crafty wither'd hide!</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I have faced it with a card of ten.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis in my head to do my master good:</div>
                     <div class="line">I see no reason but supposed Lucentio</div>
                     <div class="line">Must get a father, call'd 'supposed Vincentio;'</div>
                     <div class="line">And that's a wonder: fathers commonly</div>
                     <div class="line">Do get their children; but in this case of wooing,</div>
                     <div class="line">A child shall get a sire, if I fail not of my cunning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LUCENTIO, HORTENSIO, and BIANCA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fiddler, forbear; you grow too forward, sir:</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you so soon forgot the entertainment</div>
                     <div class="line">Her sister Katharina welcomed you withal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But, wrangling pedant, this is</div>
                     <div class="line">The patroness of heavenly harmony:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then give me leave to have prerogative;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when in music we have spent an hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lecture shall have leisure for as much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Preposterous ass, that never read so far</div>
                     <div class="line">To know the cause why music was ordain'd!</div>
                     <div class="line">Was it not to refresh the mind of man</div>
                     <div class="line">After his studies or his usual pain?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then give me leave to read philosophy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And while I pause, serve in your harmony.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, I will not bear these braves of thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, gentlemen, you do me double wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">To strive for that which resteth in my choice:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am no breeching scholar in the schools;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not be tied to hours nor 'pointed times,</div>
                     <div class="line">But learn my lessons as I please myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to cut off all strife, here sit we down:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take you your instrument, play you the whiles;</div>
                     <div class="line">His lecture will be done ere you have tuned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll leave his lecture when I am in tune?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That will be never: tune your instrument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Where left we last?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, madam:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Hic ibat Simois; hic est Sigeia tellus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hic steterat Priami regia celsa senis.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Construe them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Hic ibat,' as I told you before, 'Simois,' I am</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucentio, 'hic est,' son unto Vincentio of Pisa,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sigeia tellus,' disguised thus to get your love;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Hic steterat,' and that Lucentio that comes</div>
                     <div class="line">a-wooing, 'Priami,' is my man Tranio, 'regia,'</div>
                     <div class="line">bearing my port, 'celsa senis,' that we might</div>
                     <div class="line">beguile the old pantaloon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, my instrument's in tune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's hear. O fie! the treble jars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Spit in the hole, man, and tune again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now let me see if I can construe it: 'Hic ibat</div>
                     <div class="line">Simois,' I know you not, 'hic est Sigeia tellus,' I</div>
                     <div class="line">trust you not; 'Hic steterat Priami,' take heed</div>
                     <div class="line">he hear us not, 'regia,' presume not, 'celsa senis,'</div>
                     <div class="line">despair not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, 'tis now in tune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">All but the base.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The base is right; 'tis the base knave that jars.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">How fiery and forward our pedant is!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, for my life, the knave doth court my love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pedascule, I'll watch you better yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">In time I may believe, yet I mistrust.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistrust it not: for, sure, AEacides</div>
                     <div class="line">Was Ajax, call'd so from his grandfather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">I must believe my master; else, I promise you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should be arguing still upon that doubt:</div>
                     <div class="line">But let it rest. Now, Licio, to you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Good masters, take it not unkindly, pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have been thus pleasant with you both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You may go walk, and give me leave a while:</div>
                     <div class="line">My lessons make no music in three parts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you so formal, sir? well, I must wait,</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">And watch withal; for, but I be deceived,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our fine musician groweth amorous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, before you touch the instrument,</div>
                     <div class="line">To learn the order of my fingering,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must begin with rudiments of art;</div>
                     <div class="line">To teach you gamut in a briefer sort,</div>
                     <div class="line">More pleasant, pithy and effectual,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than hath been taught by any of my trade:</div>
                     <div class="line">And there it is in writing, fairly drawn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I am past my gamut long ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet read the gamut of Hortensio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  ''Gamut' I am, the ground of all accord,</div>
                     <div class="line">'A re,' to Plead Hortensio's passion;</div>
                     <div class="line">'B mi,' Bianca, take him for thy lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">'C fa ut,' that loves with all affection:</div>
                     <div class="line">'D sol re,' one clef, two notes have I:</div>
                     <div class="line">'E la mi,' show pity, or I die.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you this gamut? tut, I like it not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Old fashions please me best; I am not so nice,</div>
                     <div class="line">To change true rules for old inventions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistress, your father prays you leave your books</div>
                     <div class="line">And help to dress your sister's chamber up:</div>
                     <div class="line">You know to-morrow is the wedding-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, sweet masters both; I must be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BIANCA and Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, mistress, then I have no cause to stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But I have cause to pry into this pedant:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks he looks as though he were in love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet if thy thoughts, Bianca, be so humble</div>
                     <div class="line">To cast thy wandering eyes on every stale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seize thee that list: if once I find thee ranging,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hortensio will be quit with thee by changing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BAPTISTA, GREMIO, TRANIO, KATHARINA, BIANCA,
LUCENTIO, and others, attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To TRANIO</span>  Signior Lucentio, this is the</div>
                     <div class="line">'pointed day.</div>
                     <div class="line">That Katharina and Petruchio should be married,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet we hear not of our son-in-law.</div>
                     <div class="line">What will be said? what mockery will it be,</div>
                     <div class="line">To want the bridegroom when the priest attends</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak the ceremonial rites of marriage!</div>
                     <div class="line">What says Lucentio to this shame of ours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">No shame but mine: I must, forsooth, be forced</div>
                     <div class="line">To give my hand opposed against my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto a mad-brain rudesby full of spleen;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who woo'd in haste and means to wed at leisure.</div>
                     <div class="line">I told you, I, he was a frantic fool,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hiding his bitter jests in blunt behavior:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to be noted for a merry man,</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll woo a thousand, 'point the day of marriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make feasts, invite friends, and proclaim the banns;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet never means to wed where he hath woo'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now must the world point at poor Katharina,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say, 'Lo, there is mad Petruchio's wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">If it would please him come and marry her!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience, good Katharina, and Baptista too.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my life, Petruchio means but well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whatever fortune stays him from his word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though he be blunt, I know him passing wise;</div>
                     <div class="line">Though he be merry, yet withal he's honest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Would Katharina had never seen him though!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit weeping, followed by BIANCA and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, girl; I cannot blame thee now to weep;</div>
                     <div class="line">For such an injury would vex a very saint,</div>
                     <div class="line">Much more a shrew of thy impatient humour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BIONDELLO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, master! news, old news, and such news as</div>
                     <div class="line">you never heard of!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it new and old too? how may that be?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, is it not news, to hear of Petruchio's coming?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, no, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">What then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">When will he be here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">When he stands where I am and sees you there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But say, what to thine old news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Petruchio is coming in a new hat and an old</div>
                     <div class="line">jerkin, a pair of old breeches thrice turned, a pair</div>
                     <div class="line">of boots that have been candle-cases, one buckled,</div>
                     <div class="line">another laced, an old rusty sword ta'en out of the</div>
                     <div class="line">town-armory, with a broken hilt, and chapeless;</div>
                     <div class="line">with two broken points: his horse hipped with an</div>
                     <div class="line">old mothy saddle and stirrups of no kindred;</div>
                     <div class="line">besides, possessed with the glanders and like to mose</div>
                     <div class="line">in the chine; troubled with the lampass, infected</div>
                     <div class="line">with the fashions, full of wingdalls, sped with</div>
                     <div class="line">spavins, rayed with yellows, past cure of the fives,</div>
                     <div class="line">stark spoiled with the staggers, begnawn with the</div>
                     <div class="line">bots, swayed in the back and shoulder-shotten;</div>
                     <div class="line">near-legged before and with, a half-chequed bit</div>
                     <div class="line">and a head-stall of sheeps leather which, being</div>
                     <div class="line">restrained to keep him from stumbling, hath been</div>
                     <div class="line">often burst and now repaired with knots; one girth</div>
                     <div class="line">six time pieced and a woman's crupper of velure,</div>
                     <div class="line">which hath two letters for her name fairly set down</div>
                     <div class="line">in studs, and here and there pieced with packthread.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who comes with him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, his lackey, for all the world caparisoned</div>
                     <div class="line">like the horse; with a linen stock on one leg and a</div>
                     <div class="line">kersey boot-hose on the other, gartered with a red</div>
                     <div class="line">and blue list; an old hat and 'the humour of forty</div>
                     <div class="line">fancies' pricked in't for a feather: a monster, a</div>
                     <div class="line">very monster in apparel, and not like a Christian</div>
                     <div class="line">footboy or a gentleman's lackey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis some odd humour pricks him to this fashion;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet oftentimes he goes but mean-apparell'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad he's come, howsoe'er he comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, he comes not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou not say he comes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who? that Petruchio came?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that Petruchio came.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, I say his horse comes, with him on his back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that's all one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIONDELLO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, by Saint Jamy,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold you a penny,</div>
                     <div class="line">A horse and a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Is more than one,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet not many.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PETRUCHIO and GRUMIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, where be these gallants? who's at home?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">You are welcome, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I come not well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet you halt not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so well apparell'd</div>
                     <div class="line">As I wish you were.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were it better, I should rush in thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">But where is Kate? where is my lovely bride?</div>
                     <div class="line">How does my father? Gentles, methinks you frown:</div>
                     <div class="line">And wherefore gaze this goodly company,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if they saw some wondrous monument,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some comet or unusual prodigy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, you know this is your wedding-day:</div>
                     <div class="line">First were we sad, fearing you would not come;</div>
                     <div class="line">Now sadder, that you come so unprovided.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, doff this habit, shame to your estate,</div>
                     <div class="line">An eye-sore to our solemn festival!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And tells us, what occasion of import</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath all so long detain'd you from your wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sent you hither so unlike yourself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tedious it were to tell, and harsh to hear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sufficeth I am come to keep my word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though in some part enforced to digress;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, at more leisure, I will so excuse</div>
                     <div class="line">As you shall well be satisfied withal.</div>
                     <div class="line">But where is Kate? I stay too long from her:</div>
                     <div class="line">The morning wears, 'tis time we were at church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">See not your bride in these unreverent robes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to my chamber; Put on clothes of mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, believe me: thus I'll visit her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">But thus, I trust, you will not marry her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sooth, even thus; therefore ha' done with words:</div>
                     <div class="line">To me she's married, not unto my clothes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Could I repair what she will wear in me,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I can change these poor accoutrements,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere well for Kate and better for myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what a fool am I to chat with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I should bid good morrow to my bride,</div>
                     <div class="line">And seal the title with a lovely kiss!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PETRUCHIO and GRUMIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath some meaning in his mad attire:</div>
                     <div class="line">We will persuade him, be it possible,</div>
                     <div class="line">To put on better ere he go to church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll after him, and see the event of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BAPTISTA, GREMIO, and attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But to her love concerneth us to add</div>
                     <div class="line">Her father's liking: which to bring to pass,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I before unparted to your worship,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am to get a man,--whate'er he be,</div>
                     <div class="line">It skills not much. we'll fit him to our turn,--</div>
                     <div class="line">And he shall be Vincentio of Pisa;</div>
                     <div class="line">And make assurance here in Padua</div>
                     <div class="line">Of greater sums than I have promised.</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall you quietly enjoy your hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">And marry sweet Bianca with consent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were it not that my fellow-school-master</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth watch Bianca's steps so narrowly,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere good, methinks, to steal our marriage;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which once perform'd, let all the world say no,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll keep mine own, despite of all the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That by degrees we mean to look into,</div>
                     <div class="line">And watch our vantage in this business:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll over-reach the greybeard, Gremio,</div>
                     <div class="line">The narrow-prying father, Minola,</div>
                     <div class="line">The quaint musician, amorous Licio;</div>
                     <div class="line">All for my master's sake, Lucentio.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter GREMIO</p>
                     <div class="line">Signior Gremio, came you from the church?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">As willingly as e'er I came from school.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And is the bride and bridegroom coming home?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A bridegroom say you? 'tis a groom indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">A grumbling groom, and that the girl shall find.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Curster than she? why, 'tis impossible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why he's a devil, a devil, a very fiend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, she's a devil, a devil, the devil's dam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, she's a lamb, a dove, a fool to him!</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell you, Sir Lucentio: when the priest</div>
                     <div class="line">Should ask, if Katharina should be his wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Ay, by gogs-wouns,' quoth he; and swore so loud,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, all-amazed, the priest let fall the book;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as he stoop'd again to take it up,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mad-brain'd bridegroom took him such a cuff</div>
                     <div class="line">That down fell priest and book and book and priest:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Now take them up,' quoth he, 'if any list.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What said the wench when he rose again?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Trembled and shook; for why, he stamp'd and swore,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if the vicar meant to cozen him.</div>
                     <div class="line">But after many ceremonies done,</div>
                     <div class="line">He calls for wine: 'A health!' quoth he, as if</div>
                     <div class="line">He had been aboard, carousing to his mates</div>
                     <div class="line">After a storm; quaff'd off the muscadel</div>
                     <div class="line">And threw the sops all in the sexton's face;</div>
                     <div class="line">Having no other reason</div>
                     <div class="line">But that his beard grew thin and hungerly</div>
                     <div class="line">And seem'd to ask him sops as he was drinking.</div>
                     <div class="line">This done, he took the bride about the neck</div>
                     <div class="line">And kiss'd her lips with such a clamorous smack</div>
                     <div class="line">That at the parting all the church did echo:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I seeing this came thence for very shame;</div>
                     <div class="line">And after me, I know, the rout is coming.</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a mad marriage never was before:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, hark! I hear the minstrels play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music</p>
               <p>Re-enter PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, BIANCA, BAPTISTA,
HORTENSIO, GRUMIO, and Train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen and friends, I thank you for your pains:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you think to dine with me to-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have prepared great store of wedding cheer;</div>
                     <div class="line">But so it is, my haste doth call me hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore here I mean to take my leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible you will away to-night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must away to-day, before night come:</div>
                     <div class="line">Make it no wonder; if you knew my business,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would entreat me rather go than stay.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, honest company, I thank you all,</div>
                     <div class="line">That have beheld me give away myself</div>
                     <div class="line">To this most patient, sweet and virtuous wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">Dine with my father, drink a health to me;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I must hence; and farewell to you all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us entreat you stay till after dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It may not be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me entreat you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me entreat you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you content to stay?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content you shall entreat me stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet not stay, entreat me how you can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, if you love me, stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Grumio, my horse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRUMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, they be ready: the oats have eaten the horses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do what thou canst, I will not go to-day;</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor to-morrow, not till I please myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">The door is open, sir; there lies your way;</div>
                     <div class="line">You may be jogging whiles your boots are green;</div>
                     <div class="line">For me, I'll not be gone till I please myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis like you'll prove a jolly surly groom,</div>
                     <div class="line">That take it on you at the first so roundly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O Kate, content thee; prithee, be not angry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be angry: what hast thou to do?</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, be quiet; he shall stay my leisure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, sir, now it begins to work.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen, forward to the bridal dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">I see a woman may be made a fool,</div>
                     <div class="line">If she had not a spirit to resist.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETRUCHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall go forward, Kate, at thy command.</div>
                     <div class="line">Obey the bride, you that attend on her;</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to the feast, revel and domineer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Carouse full measure to her maidenhead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be mad and merry, or go hang yourselves:</div>
                     <div class="line">But for my bonny Kate, she must with me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, look not big, nor stamp, nor stare, nor fret;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be master of what is mine own:</div>
                     <div class="line">She is my goods, my chattels; she is my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">My household stuff, my field, my barn,</div>
                     <div class="line">My horse, my ox, my ass, my any thing;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here she stands, touch her whoever dare;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring mine action on the proudest he</div>
                     <div class="line">That stops my way in Padua. Grumio,</div>
                     <div class="line">Draw forth thy weapon, we are beset with thieves;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rescue thy mistress, if thou be a man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, sweet wench, they shall not touch</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, Kate:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll buckler thee against a million.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, and GRUMIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let them go, a couple of quiet ones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Went they not quickly, I should die with laughing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all mad matches never was the like.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistress, what's your opinion of your sister?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIANCA</div>
                     <div class="line">That, being mad herself, she's madly mated.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant him, Petruchio is Kated.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Neighbours and friends, though bride and</div>
                     <div class="line">bridegroom wants</div>
                     <div class="line">For to supply the places at the table,</div>
                     <div class="line">You know there wants no junkets at the feast.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucentio, you shall supply the bridegroom's place:</div>
                     <div class="line">And let Bianca take her sister's room.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TRANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall sweet Bianca practise how to bride it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BAPTISTA</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall, Lucentio. Come, gentlemen, let's go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  A public road.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GRUMIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRUMIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie on all tired jades, on all mad masters, and</div>
                     <div class="line">all foul ways! Was ever man so beaten? was ever</div>
                     <div class="line">man so rayed? was ever man so weary? I am sent</div>
                     <div class="line">before to make a fire, and they are coming after to</div>
                     <div class="line">warm them. Now, were not I a little pot and soon</div>
                     <div class="line">hot, my very lips might freeze to my teeth, my</div>
                     <div class="line">tongue to the roof of my mouth, my heart in my</div>
                     <div class="line">belly, ere I should come by a fire to thaw me: but</div>
                     <div class="line">I, with blowing the fire, shall warm myself; for,</div>
                     <div class="line">considering the weather, a taller man than I will</div>
                     <div class="line">take cold. Holla, ho! Curtis.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CURTIS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CURTIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is that calls so coldly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
